We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated .NET Full Stack Developer to join our development team. You will be responsible for building robust, scalable, and modern web applications using technologies such as .NET Core, ASP.NET Core MVC/Web API, MS SQL Server, and JavaScript.   • Collaborate with designers, product managers, and engineering teams to deliver high-quality user experiences.

  • Solid experience working with MS SQL Server or other relational databases.

job_description:
Operations Manager

Applied Payments is a leading payment technology vendor delivering modern, scalable, and secure software solutions to banks, fintechs, PSPs, and enterprise clients. Our mission is to simplify and accelerate digital payments through innovative technology and exceptional delivery.

We are expanding our global operations and looking for a highly capable Operations Manager to oversee operational delivery, manage technical teams, and ensure seamless experiences for our clients.

Role Overview

As an Operations Manager at Applied Payments, you will lead the end-to-end operational lifecycle for our software deployments and client engagements. You will work closely with engineering, product, support, and customer success teams to ensure high-quality delivery, platform stability, and operational excellence.

This role includes direct management of technical teams, including software developers, implementation engineers, and support analysts.

The Operations Manager will work closely with clients, engineering, product, QA, and support teams to ensure seamless deployments, prompt issue resolution, and operational excellence across all engagements.

Key Responsibilities

Operational Leadership

  • Oversee daily operations across client projects, deployments, and production environments.
  • Ensure all SLAs and service commitments are met with consistency and transparency.
  • Lead incident resolution, coordinating closely with development and support teams.

Team Management

  • Manage and mentor a technical operational team including software developers.
  • Plan and allocate resources across projects while ensuring timely delivery.
  • Foster a collaborative environment between development and operations (DevOps mindset).

Technical & Platform Operations

  • Monitor the performance and stability of Applied Payments’ platforms across client environments.
  • Coordinate release management, patches, hotfixes, and upgrades.
  • Maintain operational runbooks, SOPs, and documentation.

Client & Cross-Functional Collaboration

  • Serve as the operational point of contact for client technology teams.
  • Work closely with engineering, QA, and product teams to ensure smooth deployments and issue resolution.
  • Provide operational insights and feedback to improve product capabilities.

Process Improvement

  • Drive continuous improvement across operational processes, automation, and monitoring.
  • Implement best practices to enhance uptime, stability, and response times.
  • Develop and track KPIs for operational performance.

Required Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience in technical operations, preferably within a payment technology or fintech software vendor.
  • Strong experience leading technical teams, including software developers.
  • Solid understanding of payment systems, transaction workflows, and API-based integrations.
  • Excellent communication skills with a client-focused mindset.
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with ISO 8583, ISO 20022, SEPA, SWIFT, card payment processing, or real-time payment systems.
  • Understanding of cloud platforms (AWS / Azure) and DevOps practices.
  • Exposure to enterprise-scale software deployments.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@appliedpaymentstech.com
summary: Manage technical teams and oversee operational delivery for software deployments. Ensure platform stability, client satisfaction, and drive continuous improvement in a fintech environment.

job_description:
Atlassian Support Specialist

About the Job

As a specialist in electronics and software for the past 20 years, in-tech is a dynamic, fast-growing engineering company headquartered in Munich, Germany, employing around 2350 employees globally across 20 project locations in 8 countries. in-tech develops innovative engineering solutions for the automotive, rail, aerospace, defence, and industrial sectors. We are committed to a flexible, modern work culture and work-life balance. Our colour orange stands for liveliness, warmth, and dynamism. We value a strong team spirit, fresh ideas, and a positive work culture. We call it the “Orange Spirit”!

Since 2024, in-tech became a subsidiary of Infosys Ltd. This strategic partnership enables us to offer our customers even more comprehensive development and digitalisation services and greater offshore capability.

We are looking for experienced Atlassian Support Specialists to join our team based out of our Kochi location with hybrid work options. If you’re passionate about joining a growing and dynamic team with a company that has a positive culture and team spirit, we’d love to connect with you!

Responsibilities

  • Administer and manage Atlassian Cloud applications including Jira, Confluence.
  • Lead and support migration activities from Atlassian Data Center to Atlassian Cloud.
  • Implement and maintain Jira Service Management (service desk projects), request types, and automations.
  • Develop and maintain scripts using ScriptRunner for Jira/Confluence and strong documentation skills.

Requirements

  • The ideal candidate would be a graduate with a minimum of 5+ years of proven work experience as an Atlassian Support Specialist or similar role.
  • Hands-on experience with administration in Atlassian cloud systems.
  • Strong knowledge in administration in Atlassian Jira and Confluence cloud systems.
  • Solid experience with Atlassian Cloud (Jira, Confluence), including automation and service desks in Atlassian Jira.
  • Solid experience in migrating from Atlassian Data Center to Atlassian Cloud.
  • Strong scripting skills using ScriptRunner for Jira/Confluence.

Apply with us

If you have experience and team spirit and are looking for a great place to work, then start your job with us.

  • Familiarity with dependency injection frameworks (Hilt, Koin, Dagger).
  • Exposure to Kotlin Multiplatform Mobile (KMM) is a plus.
  • Experience with Jetpack Compose animations and advanced UI.

    • Email problems, DNS changes, password resets, SSL installations, account setups.
    • Basic cPanel troubleshooting and customer guidance.
  • Provide L2 support for advanced hosting/server issues including:
    • Service failures (Apache, Exim, MySQL, PHP-FPM).
    • Resource usage investigation, performance optimization.
    • Advanced DNS, web server configuration, database troubleshooting.
    • Malware cleanup, log analysis, and deeper diagnostics.
    • Escalate L3 cases to senior engineers with full technical notes and findings.

cPanel Hosting Management

  • Install, configure, and manage cPanel/WHM on production servers.
  • Manage accounts, DNS zones, email services, SSLs, backups, and service configurations.
  • Troubleshoot cPanel-related issues such as:
    • Apache / Nginx errors.
    • DNS/BIND/PowerDNS issues.
    • Email queue problems (Exim/Postfix).
    • MySQL/MariaDB connectivity.
  • Perform account transfers, migrations, restores, and server optimizations.

Linux System Administration

  • Manage Linux OS: RHEL, Debian, Ubuntu.
  • Handle updates, patching, hardening, process management, and log analysis.
  • Write basic automation scripts using Bash.
  • Work with virtualization tools like Virtualizor, KVM, VMware etc.
  • Configure and manage firewalls, IP tables, security groups, and network services.

Server Monitoring and Troubleshooting

  • Monitor servers using Zabbix, Nagios, Cacti.
  • Perform system diagnostics and troubleshoot from logs and SSH.
  • Conduct malware scanning, cleanup, and generate security reports.
  • Perform remote server operations via IPMI, iDRAC, and iBMC.

Preferred Skills

Required Skills

  • Strong understanding of Linux administration.
  • Knowledge of cPanel/WHM, DNS, web hosting services, and email protocols.
  • Good troubleshooting skills for L1 and L2 tasks.
  • Knowledge of malware types, scanning tools, and server security practices.
  • Good understanding of networking (ports, protocols, DNS, firewalls).

Preferred Qualifications

  • RHCSA / RHCE certifications.
  • Experience in hosting and data center infrastructure.
  • Very good understanding of virtualization technologies.
summary: Seeking a Junior cPanel Server Administrator with 1+ years of experience. Responsibilities include L1/L2 support, cPanel/WHM management, and Linux administration.

Role Overview

We are seeking a Product Manager to own the development and delivery of impactful product features that enhance user experience and drive business growth. You will collaborate closely with engineering, design, and data teams to transform innovative ideas into market-ready solutions swiftly.

Key Responsibilities

  • End-to-End Product Ownership: Drive product features from ideation to launch, ensuring alignment with business goals and delivery of high-quality outcomes.
  • Data-Driven Decision Making: Leverage analytics and user feedback to identify opportunities and implement impactful product enhancements.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, design, and data teams to deliver seamless, timely product releases.
  • Performance Management: Track product performance metrics and execute strategies to maximize growth, retention, and engagement.
  • Stakeholder Alignment: Communicate priorities, timelines, and progress clearly to stakeholders, ensuring transparency and alignment.

  • Data-Driven Decision Making: Using quantitative and qualitative data to inform choices, validate assumptions, and measure product performance for better business outcomes.
  • User-Centric Design Thinking: Applying a creative, iterative problem-solving approach focused on understanding user needs and delivering solutions that enhance their experience.
  • Stakeholder Management: Building and maintaining positive relationships with individuals or groups who have an interest in the product, ensuring alignment and effective communication.
  • Agile Product Development: Using flexible, iterative methods to develop and deliver product features quickly, adapting to feedback and changing requirements.
  • Market & Competitive Analysis: Researching industry trends, customer behavior, and competitor offerings to identify opportunities and threats for product positioning.
  • A/B Testing & Experimentation: Comparing two or more variations of a product element with real users to determine which performs best.
  • Go-To-Market Execution: Planning and carrying out the strategies needed to launch a product successfully, including positioning, messaging, and channel selection.
  • Wireframing & Prototyping: Creating visual blueprints and interactive mockups of a product to test concepts and guide development before final build.

Role Overview

We are looking for a skilled Team Lead, SEO to lead our organic growth and enhance search engine presence. This leadership role involves developing and executing SEO strategies, managing a team, and collaborating cross-functionally to optimize our digital footprint. Ideal candidates have a deep understanding of search algorithms, technical SEO, content strategy, and a passion for driving results.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop & Execute SEO Strategies: Define and implement a robust SEO roadmap aligned with business objectives.
  • Lead & Mentor the SEO Team: Manage SEO professionals, fostering continuous learning and performance.
  • Optimize On-Page & Off-Page SEO: Improve keyword rankings, content performance, and backlink quality for enhanced organic visibility.
  • Technical SEO Management: Identify and resolve site architecture, crawl errors, indexing, and page speed issues.
  • Data-Driven Decision Making: Analyze traffic, keyword performance, and search visibility using tools like Google Analytics, Search Console, SEMrush, and Ahrefs.
  • Content & Product Collaboration: Work with content, development, and product teams to integrate SEO best practices.
  • Local & Mobile SEO Optimization: Enhance local search presence and mobile-first indexing strategies.
  • Competitive & Market Analysis: Conduct SEO audits, monitor competitors, and identify new opportunities.
  • SEO Performance Reporting: Provide insights and recommendations through detailed reports and dashboards.

Preferred Skills

  • 9-11 years of SEO experience, with at least 2 years in a team lead role.
  • Proven expertise in technical SEO, content strategy, and link-building.
  • Strong knowledge of search engine algorithms, ranking factors, and SEO trends.
  • Proficiency in Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMrush, Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, and other SEO tools.
  • Strong understanding of mobile-first indexing, Core Web Vitals, and structured data (schema markup).
  • Experience with A/B testing, conversion rate optimization (CRO), and SEO for local businesses (Google My Business optimization).
  • Ability to analyze and interpret SEO data for data-driven decisions.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and website development principles.
  • Understanding of PPC advertising and its relationship with organic search.
  • Experience in a high-growth startup or fast-paced environment.
  • Familiarity with social media marketing and its impact on SEO.
  • Strong project management skills, with the ability to prioritize and execute multiple SEO initiatives.

Why You Will Love Working With Us

  • Opportunity to work for the #1 Auto Super app in the US.
  • Make a meaningful impact across 10+ million users.
  • Dynamic, fast-paced, and innovation-driven work culture.
  • Clear pathways for career growth in a rapidly scaling technology company.
  • Competitive compensation.

job_description:
Senior Database Engineer (Microsoft SQL Server)

Company: DeviceDriven India (P) Ltd Location: Padmanabha, Technopark Campus, Trivandrum, 695581 Website: http://www.devicedriven.com Closing Date: 22, Dec 2025 Job Published: 22, Nov 2025 Contact Email: jobs@devicedriven.com

About the Opportunity

You will work on a digital transformation program modernizing a global-scale transaction and engagement platform. The platform handles millions of real-time, high-volume operations across multiple regions and partner ecosystems. We are looking for a Senior SQL Server Database Engineer who can take ownership of database performance, reliability, architecture, and operational excellence for a mission-critical, highly transactional platform running on Microsoft SQL Server in a cloud environment.

Role Overview

In this senior role, you will be the primary SQL Server expert responsible for: - Designing and optimizing database schemas - Ensuring high availability and operational resilience - Performance tuning for large-scale transactional workloads - Managing upgrades, patching, and maintenance - Supporting engineering teams during feature development and releases - Ensuring data integrity, recoverability, and system reliability

You will work closely with application engineering, DevOps, and architecture teams to ensure the platform’s data layer is fast, scalable, secure, and predictable.

Key Responsibilities

1. Database Architecture & Design - Design, model, and optimize SQL Server schemas for high-throughput transactional systems - Define best practices for indexing, normalization, partitioning, and query design - Review and guide schema evolution and data modeling decisions with engineering teams

2. Performance, Tuning & Optimization - Diagnose and resolve performance bottlenecks: blocking, deadlocks, concurrency issues, slow queries - Optimize execution plans, indexing strategies, statistics, and resource configuration - Conduct regular health assessments and create remediation plans

3. High Availability & Disaster Recovery - Design, configure, and maintain AlwaysOn Availability Groups, clustering, log shipping, replication, and other HA/DR mechanisms - Own backup, restore, and failover processes, including regular testing and validation - Ensure data consistency, integrity, and uptime across multiple environments

4. Operations, Monitoring & Reliability - Monitor SQL Server performance using DMVs, PerfMon, Extended Events, Query Store, and profiling tools - Establish alerting and automated monitoring for query performance, storage, replication, and job failures - Own routine maintenance: index management, statistics updates, patching, upgrades

5. Cloud & Platform Integration (GCP Environment) - Manage SQL Server deployments and operations within a GCP-hosted environment - Collaborate with DevOps and infrastructure teams on provisioning, scaling, security, and observability - Integrate DB operations into CI/CD and release processes (migrations, pre-flight checks, rollback strategies)

6. Security, Access & Compliance Alignment - Implement secure authentication, authorization, role management, and least-privilege access - Maintain auditing, logging, and compliance-aligned configuration for sensitive financial data - Ensure encryption, retention, and governance policies are enforced

7. Data Integration, Reporting & Migration - Support ETL, reporting, and analytical workloads via SSIS/SSRS or equivalent tools - Lead structured data migration efforts between environments or SQL Server versions - Work with engineering teams to expose reliable, efficient data interfaces

Required Skills & Qualifications

Technical Expertise - 7–12+ years in Database Engineering / SQL Server Administration - Strong hands-on expertise in: - Microsoft SQL Server (advanced configuration, tuning, internals) - AlwaysOn, clustering, replication, log shipping - Performance tuning and query optimization - Backup/restore, DR planning, failover testing - SQL Profiler, Extended Events, DMVs, Query Store - Experience supporting high-volume OLTP systems - Experience operating SQL Server in cloud environments (GCP preferred; AWS/Azure acceptable) - Strong understanding of concurrency, locking, transactions, isolation levels, and recovery models

Nice-to-Have - SSIS / SSRS / ETL experience - Experience with Looker, data warehousing, or analytical pipelines - Experience with container-based or microservices ecosystems - Fintech or regulated environment experience - Exposure to automation via scripting (PowerShell, Python, Bash)

Soft Skills - Strong ownership and accountability - Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities - Clear communication and ability to work with cross-functional teams - Calm under pressure and experienced with production incident handling - Strong documentation discipline

Why Join DeviceDriven

  • Work on a global, high-volume platform with real engineering complexity
  • Take full ownership of the database layer in a modern cloud environment
  • Collaborate with senior architects, backend, DevOps, and AI engineering teams
  • Opportunity to evolve into Database Architect or Platform Data Engineering Lead roles
  • Culture of technical excellence, autonomy, and innovation

How to Apply

Send your resume, GitHub/LinkedIn profile, and a short introduction to: jobs@devicedriven.com
summary: Senior SQL Server Database Engineer needed for a global digital transformation program. Responsible for database performance, reliability, and architecture in a cloud environment.
